properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.enabled
properties.description:
Enable/disable the MCP client.

When set to false, the MCP client and all its components will not be initialized.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.initialized
properties.description: Flag to indicate if the MCP client has to be initialized.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.name
properties.description:
The name of the MCP client instance.

This name is reported to clients and used for compatibility checks.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.request-timeout
properties.description:
The timeout duration for MCP client requests.

Defaults to 20 seconds.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.root-change-notification
properties.description:
Flag to enable/disable root change notifications.

When enabled, the client will be notified of changes to the root configuration. Defaults to true.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.sse.connections
properties.description:
Map of named SSE connection configurations.

The key represents the connection name, and the value contains the SSE parameters for that connection.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.stdio.connections
properties.description:
Map of MCP stdio connections configurations.

Each entry represents a named connection with its specific configuration parameters.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.stdio.servers-configuration
properties.description:
Resource containing the MCP servers configuration.

This resource should contain a JSON configuration defining the MCP servers and their parameters.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.toolcallback.enabled
properties.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the tool callback is enabled. If true, the tool callback is active; otherwise, it is disabled.

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.type
properties.description:
The type of client to use for MCP client communication.

Supported types are:

  • SYNC - Standard synchronous client (default)
  • ASYNC - Asynchronous client

properties.name: spring.ai.mcp.client.version
properties.description:
The version of the MCP client instance.

This version is reported to clients and used for compatibility checks.
